Description: Cylindrical corroded copper alloy vessel broken into eighteen fragments.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound
Curator's comments: One of the "three bronze pots of cylindrical form" found on the North-West ptolemaic mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 61 § 57; the two other pots are London, BM, EA 23644 and Boston, MFA, 87.496 a-b. Two of these three items must be the "two bronze vessels..., cylindrical with flat base, 4.0 in. across and 4.8 in. high", mentioned by Petrie, ibid., p. 79 § 79.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 57, p. 79 § 79)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.42, p.51, p.52, fig.1, p.173, pl.15)
